result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M. Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED ON 07-23-2014 TO REFLECT FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS OF DEADTIME CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.**
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in file 2012CF000564.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs. Court costs are paid in full.
-------------------------------

Obtain high school diploma or HSED. Maintain employment at least on a part-time basis.
-------------------------------

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without the Agent's permission. no contact with the victims without their consent and Agent approval.
-------------------------------

Lifetime registration as a sex offender. Comply with rules of SORP. Enter into and complete any counseling as ordered by the Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------------

supervisions.notes:
*AMENDMENT 7/10/2018 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 311 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 12CF564 and 17CF159.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric M. Hudson in court with attorney James B Duquette.  Diane M Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No PSI ordered and matter set over for argued sentencing. Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Eric M. Hudson in court with attorney James B Duquette.  Joshua P Grube appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set for FPT and Jury Trial.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric M. Hudson in court with attorneys Ted Kmiec (2012CF000564) and James B. Duquette (2014CF000018).  Joshua P. Grube appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  File 2012CF000564 is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  File 2014CF000018 is tracking and set for status conference today.  Attorney Kmiec has reviewed the PSI with this client and has no corrections.  The State has complied with victim notification.  The Court has reviewed the victim's mother's statement as an addendum to the PSI.  Parties confirm court's understanding that they are free to argue, and the State will make no specific recommendation as to length of jail or prison.  Attorney Grube has concerns about information that was not contained in the pre-sentence report.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys concerning rescheduling of sentencing hearing.  Court will order an updated PSI and ask the PSI writer to address the matters outlined by Attorney Grube in Court here today.  Attorney Duquette requests that file 2014CF000018 "track" to the next sentencing hearing date.  Minutes files.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM (DOB JANUARY OF 1999) OR WITH FEMALES IN THE DATING SENSE. NO CONTACT WITH MINOR FEMALES OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.DEFENDANT MUST LIVE WITH FATHER. DEFENDANT MUST ATTEND SCHOOL.
